title: Dubai unveils 10 new mosques ahead of Ramadan 2026, 5 more to boost worship capacity
summary_full: Dubai is expanding its spiritual infrastructure with 15 new mosques opening for Ramadan, aiming to accommodate its growing population and enhance community life. These new sanctuaries, strategically located across residential hubs, will serve as spiritual and social centers, hosting events and offering inclusive services. The city also plans for 55 more mosques, including a 3D-printed one by 2026.
